questions.text: In 2001, which country has the longest official name?
questions.explanation:
Libya.

	Libya's full official name is "al-Jamahiriyah al-'Arabiyah al-Libiyah ash-Sha'biyah al-Ishtirakiyah, which has 59 letters.

questions.text: During the twentieth century, which country has won the most medals at one Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation:
United States.

	The United States won 80 gold medals, 86 silver, and 72 bronze for a total of 238 medals at the 1904 St. Louis Olympics.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the most common cause of fatal crashes in the US?
questions.correct: Failure to keep in proper lane, or running off road
options: Driving too fast for conditions, or in excess of posted speed limit
Failure to obey traffic signs, signals, or officer
questions.explanation:
Failure to keep in proper lane, or running off road.

	Because people failed to keep in their proper lane, or ran off the road, 16,904 lives were taken in 2001.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the biggest alcohol-consuming country per capita?
questions.explanation:
Luxembourg.

	Luxembourg consumes 12.2 liters of alcohol per capita.

questions.text: In 2001, what country is the leading consumer of vegetables per capita?
questions.explanation:
Lebanon.

	Lebanon consumes 766 pounds of vegetables per capita! WOW!

questions.text: In 2001, who is responsible for the world's worst gun massacre?
questions.explanation:
Woo Bum Kong.

	The Woo Bum Kong Massacre took place in Sang-Namdo, South Korea, in 1982, where a drunk and disgruntled policeman, Woo Bum Kong, went on a rampage with hand grenades and rifles, killing 57 and injuring 38 before blowing himself up with a grenade.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the most common name for a dog in the US?
questions.explanation:
Max.

	The American Pet Classics Association did a census and found out that the most common dog name is Max.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the tallest freestanding sculptured mural?
questions.explanation:
Chief Crazy Horse.

	Chief Crazy Horse was made in South Dakota by Polish-American sculptor Korczak Ziolkowski in 1948, and continued after his death in 1982 by his widow and eight of his children. The mural is 641 feet long and 563 feet high.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the largest library in the world?
questions.explanation:
Library of Congress.

	The Library of Congress in Washington DC, was founded in 1800 and has over 24,000,000 books.

questions.text: In 2001, what is the cloudiest place on earth?
questions.explanation:
Ben Nevis, Scotland.

	On average Ben Nevis, Scotland gets 736 hours of sunshine annually.
